title.narrative: POLICIES & GUIDELINES FOR INCLUSIVE WASH

description.narrative: Select MDAs are better able to formulate policies, plans and guidelines for the sustainable management of water, sanitation and hygiene

participating-org.narrative: CIVIL SOCIETY ORGANIZATION: Community based organization

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water supply - rural communities service delivery

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Select MDAs are better able to formulate policies, plans and guidelines for the sustainable management of water, sanitation and hygiene

description.narrative: UNICEF with partners, supported the WASH sector (including the education and health sectors) to strengthen an enabling environment that respects the dignity of all caregivers and care seekers, especially mothers, new-borns, and children by developing guidelines and strategies; improve data management systems; plan and implement assessments of WASH services; and strengthen capacities to respond to emergencies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:06/01/2020

title.narrative: National and subnational water safety framework in place

target.value: 2021:Existence of water safety framework that is operational

actual.value: 2019:Water safety framework has not been reviewed. This is due to the process of reorganizing the ministry structure where a new rural water agency has been introduced to undertake rural water and sanitation activities and to be under ministry of water and not PORALG

title.narrative: Level of inclusion of SDG targets and approaches in revised national water policy (NAWAPO)

target.value: 2021:Level 3 – Full inclusion in revised NAWAPO operational

actual.value: 2019:The revision of NAWAPO has started where a consultant has been engaged and started work where inception report has been submitted and accepted. Consultation is different stakeholders has started

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available

actual.value: 2020:Database updating has been completed. Training of Trainers to MoH staff have been completed. The cascading trainings to regional and district user level is planned but not implemented due to funding constraints at the ministry. In discussion with the Ministry in 2020 to implement this.

title.narrative: National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender

actual.value: 2019:Strategy development has taken place awaiting final review by stakeholders followed by endosement by MoH
